item.description:
“Storms That Changed New Hampshire”
Wednesday, November 17, 2010
10:00 a.m. in the Elm Street Gallery, Millyard Museum
FREE Admission

Enjoy a fascinating presentation by WMUR-TV morning meteorologist Kevin Skarupa as he takes a look at 20 towns in the state, the biggest storms they ever had, and how it changed them forever. It will be a true weather history lesson for New Hampshire spanning the 1821 tornado, to the 1936 flood that so devastated Manchester - all the way through the 2006 floods in several parts
of the state. Kevin will discuss all 20 storms that will be shown on the Channel 9 morning show in November.
item.name: "Storms That Changed New Hampshire" with Meteorologist Kevin Skarupa
